response.answer_text: I have had abilities to communicate with the other side since the age of seven. I wasn’t frightened by it but rather intrigued. I remember telling my father about hearing his mom speaking to him from her grave in a heavy Italian accent. My dad would speak to her without saying it out loud and yet I could tell him the entire conversation. I at that time never knew her nor seen a picture of her. She died when my dad was approx 6 months old. I always felt her around me. As years went on I started to notice other abilities, senses that no one else saw or heard. I never discussed with any of my friends in my teens or twenties. I now am able to help people who are facing paranormal affliction. I am partner in a group who does this for non profit. It is like having a sixth sense. I have told things that spirits are telling me that no one knew and it was verified afterwards. I passed over a young boy, who I also captured him on a EVP recording. Approximately 2 years later I met a person from a different state and didnt know me and I was going to get a past life reading and before we started she told me “You passed a young boy over to go to his family and he is here with his father and they want to thank you for joining them together. She said the boy around 7 or 8 was smiling.” I was so excited to hear this. There is a very thin veil between our world and the other side. I know to just accept my instincts and am grateful for the abilities I have and to be able to help those who need help. PS….The recording I had was that little boy when I asked how old he was and his reply was loud and clear “7”.

No, you can’t know unless you prove it to yourself. The bigger point is that you should not show others your powers or even tell them you have them. Why? This is because they will only believe you if you constantly show them. Once one gets going with their bragging rights — you can bet the ego grows. Please understand this next point and take it to heart. You got the powers because you worked the spiritual path and lowered the amount of ego in you. So, bragging by showing off the powers puts back the ego you struggled to lower. Mystics report that not only does the ego come back more powerful, but it will take you longer this time around to reach the ground you gained. Then you have karma. Karma is based on your actions. If you do harm to others that karma is on you. Understand that karma can be obvious and it can be subtle and undetected by you. This is why mystics say that if during your practice you receive powers — don’t use them and fined a good guru who can remove them for you, if you can’t maintain or control yourself. Once you begin showing off your power, you are no longer walking the spiritual path. The power was given you to show the level you have reached, making it only for your benefit; not any one else. I hope this helps you.

No, psychic powers are non-existent. No evidence for them at all after years of research, some with a $1,000,000 reward. Some people are very convinced that they possess these powers, but until they can provide robust evidence, I’m sorry to say that they are at best deluded and more likely mentally ill. Most psychics are just faking it to defraud money out of gullible bereaved people. If they wish to prove me wrong on that - bring it on, we will set up some research. The only condition is that when I show you to be a fraud, you have to pay me for the research trial. If you show yourself to have magic powers you get to be the most famous person in the world, and can go and take a six-figure salary from your government - they won’t need spies any more will they? Oh! But I forgot, you don’t need money because your ghostie friends can tell you the next lottery result.

Hi Allison, Personally, I prefer the term psychic abilities. I think there are too many ‘power’ hungry people in the world! Sometimes people are aware of their abilities from the beginning, sometimes not. It may depend on a person having a self-aware family. My mum spent most of her life keeping quiet about being psychic, (she apologized to me at the end), so I didn’t get validation from her for a long time. I kept my ‘secret life’ to myself and thought perhaps that many people had the experiences I did but didn’t talk about it. I’ve found out in the last few years that my grandmother and her sister (both of whom I never met before they passed) and my cousin (who I do know and who is still with us) are all psychic. I also have a cousin in Australia who is a Shaman, go figure. In my case, several different people kept telling me I was psychic, and that it would be a good idea to get training. If you are not sure, you can try ESP tests on line like the ESP trainer by Russell Targ, who ran Project Stargate (remote viewing) for the US Navy. It’s a free app you can download and play with. Here’s the main site. Russell Targ | ESPResearch.com I also offer readings to help assess your psychic abilities. Hope that helps. Lots of light Sarah

Greetings Allison, I’m not comfortable using the word ‘powers’ as for me it gives the impression of having an supernatural ability when anyone who can demonstrate an ability which isn’t normally accepted by the general population. Dogmatic beliefs, and ritualized fears over the centuries has done its work. We all have psychic abilities, some people choose not to be the catalyst to bring their talents to light, in fear of being judged, chastised for being different. Self-evident for some people, a curse for others and a heck of a lot of work for those people who choose to bare the brunt of everyone’s fears in order to assist others in some way. I feel a lack of knowledge, understanding, imprinted beliefs and the fear of other’s hostility forces some people to hold their own council and keep to themselves their abilities.
It’s self-evident that they are completely bogus and do not exist. If they did, why did exactly zero psychics predict COVID-19?

I would like to turn away from the term “psychic powers,” which seem to connote some kind of magical or unnatural development. I think that such abilities are entirely natural, and given a suitable cultural environment and positive personal qualities, they will manifest themselves when required by circumstances.

Thank you for your question. I prefer to steer away from the word ‘power’ and use the word ‘ability’. No ~ they are not always self-evident because … … some people have them and the abilities are ‘dormant’ / not awakened / never used / not developed / misunderstood etc.

Something that is not proven to exist, is not self evident. Thus far no-one who ever claimed to have psychic powers actually could prove it… If anything: believing you have a psychic power is clearly a delusion.
Psychic powers disappear when tested under controlled conditions.
Given that most humans seem to have some psychic abilities according to numerous studies, yet very few use them, I would say that they are not self-evident.
